Articles.Content:
I would really like to try out writing plugins. I write C# for a living so that doesn't scare me. And I have started to wade through KSP and Unity documentation. I would like to get a sense if what I want is possible.

My primary goal would is to have CelestialBody have 2 different gravity parameters. One that is the "true" gravity that actually controls all vessels, and the "believed" gravity which would be used when display the "expected" orbits. So essentially I would just want a second parameter (or set of parameters) that is only used when drawing the orbital lines of all orbiting objects.

Is this possible?

What would I need to do to accomplish it?

Can I override the base KSP classes? If so how?

Are there any current mods with code that might do something similar?

Much thanks ahead of time for any help!

Overriding parameters of planets is not big problem.


Celestial Body minmus = ScaledSpace.Instance.gameObject.transform.FindChild("Minmus").GetComponent<CelestialBody>();

I think, that there are the fields you want

You can alse find inspiration in Real Solar System's source code.
